description: From Middle English kiþen, küthen, kithen, from Old English cȳþan, from Proto-West Germanic *kunþijan, from Proto-Germanic *kunþijaną (“to make known”).

verbs.description: kithe (third-person singular simple present kithes, present participle kithing, simple past and past participle kithed)

entries.meaning: (archaic in Scotland, obsolete elsewhere) To make known; to reveal.
examples: These lines are sent by me, To kithe my love to thee.
